title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 Corinthians chapter 7 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 Corinthians Chapter 7.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 7:2, what is recommended to avoid fornication?
options: Let every man have his own wife, and every woman her own husband
Live a celibate life
Fast and pray regularly
Avoid all contact with the opposite sex
questions.correctAnswer: Let every man have his own wife, and every woman her own husband
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:2 advises that to avoid fornication, each man should have his own wife and each woman her own husband.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 7:4 say about the power of the husband and wife over their bodies?
options: Neither has power over their own body but the other spouse does
Each has sole power over their own body
The husband has power over both bodies
The wife has power over both bodies
questions.correctAnswer: Neither has power over their own body but the other spouse does
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:4 states that the wife has no power over her own body, but the husband, and likewise the husband has no power over his own body, but the wife.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 7:5, when is it permissible for a husband and wife to abstain from each other?
options: With mutual consent for a time to give themselves to fasting and prayer
Whenever one wants to focus on work
When they are angry with each other
During travel
questions.correctAnswer: With mutual consent for a time to give themselves to fasting and prayer
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:5 says they should not defraud one another except with consent for a time, so they may give themselves to fasting and prayer.

questions.question: What does Paul say about marriage for those who cannot contain themselves in 1 Corinthians 7:9?
options: Let them marry, for it is better to marry than to burn
Stay single to maintain holiness
Avoid marriage at all costs
Marry only if commanded by the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: Let them marry, for it is better to marry than to burn
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:9 advises that if those unmarried cannot contain themselves, they should marry, as it is better to marry than to burn with passion.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Corinthians 7:10 states that the command 'Let not the wife depart from her husband' comes from Paul himself.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:10 clarifies that this command is not from Paul but from the Lord.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 7:14, what effect does an unbelieving spouse have on the believing partner and their children?
options: The unbelieving spouse is sanctified by the believing spouse, and the children are holy
The unbelieving spouse causes the children to be unclean
The unbelieving spouse must leave the marriage immediately
The unbelieving spouse has no effect on the believer
questions.correctAnswer: The unbelieving spouse is sanctified by the believing spouse, and the children are holy
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:14 says the unbelieving husband or wife is sanctified by the believing spouse, and the children are considered holy.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 7:17 advise about how one should live in their calling?
options: Let every man abide in the same calling wherein he was called
Change your calling to better suit your desires
Seek freedom from your calling
Ignore your calling altogether
questions.correctAnswer: Let every man abide in the same calling wherein he was called
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:17 instructs that each person should remain in the calling to which God has called them.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 7:19, circumcision is the most important thing for a believer.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:19 states that circumcision and uncircumcision are nothing, but the keeping of God's commandments is what matters.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 7:23, why should believers not be servants of men?
options: Because they are bought with a price
Because they should be free to do as they please
Because servants have no status
Because Paul dislikes servitude
questions.correctAnswer: Because they are bought with a price
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:23 says believers were bought with a price, so they should not become servants of men.

questions.question: What judgment does Paul give about virgins in 1 Corinthians 7:25?
options: He gives his judgment though he has no commandment from the Lord
He commands them to marry immediately
He forbids marriage for virgins
He tells them to fast and pray always
questions.correctAnswer: He gives his judgment though he has no commandment from the Lord
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:25 states Paul has no commandment from the Lord concerning virgins but gives his judgment as one who has received mercy.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 1 Corinthians 7:29: 'The time is short: it remaineth, that both they that have wives be as though they had _______'
options: none
many
children
wealth
questions.correctAnswer: none
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:29 says the time is short, so those who have wives should be as though they had none.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Corinthians 7:32 says that an unmarried person cares for the things of the Lord and how to please the Lord.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:32 highlights that the unmarried person is free from worldly concerns and can focus on pleasing the Lord.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 7:34, who cares more for the things of the world to please their husband?
options: The married woman
The unmarried woman
Both care equally
Neither cares for the world
questions.correctAnswer: The married woman
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:34 states that the married woman cares for the things of the world to please her husband, while the unmarried woman cares for the Lord.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 7:39, when is a wife free to marry another?
options: Only if her husband is dead and she marries in the Lord
At any time she wishes
If her husband divorces her
If she feels lonely
questions.correctAnswer: Only if her husband is dead and she marries in the Lord
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:39 explains the wife is bound as long as her husband lives but free to marry another only in the Lord if he is dead.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 1 Corinthians 7:33: 'But he that is married careth for the things that are of the _______, how he may please his wife.'
options: world
Lord
church
family
questions.correctAnswer: world
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:33 says the married man cares for the things of the world to please his wife.

medium.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 7:3-5 teach us about mutual care and respect in marriage?
options: Husbands and wives should mutually fulfill each other's needs and not withhold themselves except by mutual consent for prayer.
Husbands have authority over their wives and can decide when to withhold intimacy.
Wives should submit entirely to their husbands and avoid fasting and prayer.
Marriage partners should avoid physical contact to maintain holiness.
questions.correctAnswer: Husbands and wives should mutually fulfill each other's needs and not withhold themselves except by mutual consent for prayer.
questions.explanation: Verses 3-5 emphasize mutual benevolence and authority over each other's bodies, encouraging couples not to deprive one another except temporarily by mutual consent for prayer, so Satan does not tempt them.

questions.question: A single believer is struggling with desires for marriage. According to 1 Corinthians 7:8-9, what biblical counsel can you share?
options: It is good to remain unmarried if possible, but if one cannot contain, it is better to marry than to burn with passion.
All should marry immediately to avoid sin.
Marriage is not allowed for believers.
Remaining unmarried is sinful if one has desires.
questions.correctAnswer: It is good to remain unmarried if possible, but if one cannot contain, it is better to marry than to burn with passion.
questions.explanation: Paul encourages the unmarried and widows to stay single if they can, but if they cannot control their desires, it is better to marry to avoid burning with passion, showing wisdom in personal discipline and obedience.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 7:10-11, what should a wife do if she separates from her husband?
options: She should remain unmarried or be reconciled to her husband.
She may remarry immediately.
She should leave and marry another man.
She should seek divorce from the church elders.
questions.correctAnswer: She should remain unmarried or be reconciled to her husband.
questions.explanation: Paul commands, based on the Lord's teaching, that a wife who separates should remain unmarried or reconcile with her husband, promoting reconciliation and faithfulness in marriage.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 7:12-14 guide believers married to unbelievers?
options: If the unbelieving spouse consents to stay, the believer should not divorce, as the unbeliever is sanctified by the believer.
Believers should immediately divorce unbelievers to maintain purity.
Believers must convert their spouses before marriage.
Unbelievers have no spiritual benefit in the marriage.
questions.correctAnswer: If the unbelieving spouse consents to stay, the believer should not divorce, as the unbeliever is sanctified by the believer.
questions.explanation: Paul advises believers not to divorce unbelieving spouses who wish to remain, highlighting that the unbelieving spouse is sanctified through the believing partner, ensuring holiness within the family and children.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 7:15 teach about peace in marriages with unbelieving partners who choose to depart?
options: If the unbelieving spouse departs, the believer is not bound and God calls us to peace.
Believers must force their spouse to stay for the sake of the marriage.
Separation is always sinful and must be avoided at all costs.
Believers should seek counsel to immediately reconcile regardless of circumstances.
questions.correctAnswer: If the unbelieving spouse departs, the believer is not bound and God calls us to peace.
questions.explanation: Paul acknowledges that if the unbelieving spouse leaves, the believer is free from bondage in such cases and God calls believers to live in peace rather than conflict or bondage.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 7:17-20 teach contentment in one's calling?
options: Believers should remain in the calling where God has placed them and not seek to change it.
Believers should seek to change their social status for better opportunities.
Circumcision status determines spiritual value and calling.
Only certain callings are acceptable for believers.
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should remain in the calling where God has placed them and not seek to change it.
questions.explanation: Paul urges believers to abide in the calling they received, whether circumcised or uncircumcised, servant or free, emphasizing obedience and contentment in God's provision and calling.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 7:23, what reminder is given about our identity in Christ?
options: We are bought with a price and should not become servants of men.
We should serve earthly masters above all.
Our freedom depends on social status.
Only free men are truly servants of Christ.
questions.correctAnswer: We are bought with a price and should not become servants of men.
questions.explanation: Paul reminds believers that they were purchased at a great price (Christ's sacrifice) and thus should not become enslaved to human masters but live as servants of the Lord.

questions.question: A believer is anxious about whether to marry during difficult times. What counsel does 1 Corinthians 7:25-28 provide?
options: It is good to remain as one is during present distress, but marrying is not sin if one chooses to do so.
Everyone must marry regardless of circumstances.
Marriage is forbidden during times of trial.
Unmarried believers are sinners until they marry.
questions.correctAnswer: It is good to remain as one is during present distress, but marrying is not sin if one chooses to do so.
questions.explanation: Paul advises that while remaining unmarried is good in current distress, marrying is not sinful and those who marry should not be condemned, though marriage brings worldly troubles.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 7:29-31 encourage believers to view their earthly circumstances?
options: Believers should live as though they have no lasting attachment to worldly things because the world is passing away.
Believers should seek to accumulate wealth and possessions.
Marriage and possessions are permanent and should be prioritized.
Believers should avoid all worldly activities.
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should live as though they have no lasting attachment to worldly things because the world is passing away.
questions.explanation: Paul teaches believers to live without anxious attachment to worldly things like marriage, possessions, joy, or grief, recognizing the temporal nature of the world and focusing on eternal matters.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 7:32-34, what advantage does singleness give in serving the Lord?
options: The unmarried can focus fully on pleasing the Lord without divided interests.
The unmarried are less capable of serving the Lord.
Marriage enhances one’s ability to serve God fully.
Single people should seek marriage quickly to serve better.
questions.correctAnswer: The unmarried can focus fully on pleasing the Lord without divided interests.
questions.explanation: Paul explains the unmarried care for the things of the Lord, being free from concerns about pleasing a spouse, allowing undistracted service and devotion.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 7:36-38 say about giving a virgin in marriage?
options: Giving her in marriage is good, but not giving her in marriage is better if one can control his will.
All virgins must marry by a certain age.
Marriage is sinful for virgins.
A man who delays marriage does wrong.
questions.correctAnswer: Giving her in marriage is good, but not giving her in marriage is better if one can control his will.
questions.explanation: Paul advises that marrying a virgin is good, but if a man has the self-control and no necessity to marry, he does better by keeping her unmarried for the sake of undistracted devotion.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 7:19, circumcision or uncircumcision determines a believer's standing before God.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Paul declares that circumcision and uncircumcision are of no value, but what matters is keeping the commandments of God, emphasizing obedience over ritual status.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Corinthians 7:21-22 teaches that a servant called by the Lord is still free in Christ.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Paul states that a servant called in the Lord is the Lord's freedman, showing spiritual freedom regardless of earthly status.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to 1 Corinthians 7:40, a widow is __________ if she remains unmarried after her husband's death.
options: happier
sinful
unwise
bound
questions.correctAnswer: happier
questions.explanation: Paul expresses his judgment that a widow who remains unmarried is happier, indicating a preference for singleness in this situation for spiritual benefit.

questions.question: A believer married to an unbeliever wonders about their spiritual influence. What does 1 Corinthians 7:16 teach?
options: One may save their unbelieving spouse through their faith and conduct.
Unbelieving spouses cannot be influenced spiritually.
Believers should divorce unbelieving spouses immediately.
Faith has no impact on an unbelieving spouse.
questions.correctAnswer: One may save their unbelieving spouse through their faith and conduct.
questions.explanation: Paul encourages believers by noting that they do not know whether they may save their unbelieving spouse, suggesting the possibility of spiritual influence through faithful living.

hard.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 Corinthians Chapter 7.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 7, what is the primary reason Paul advises marriage between a man and a woman?
options: To avoid fornication
To gain social status
To fulfill the law of Moses
To have children
questions.correctAnswer: To avoid fornication
questions.explanation: In 1 Corinthians 7:2, Paul explicitly states that marriage is advised to avoid fornication.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 7, Paul mentions a mutual authority between husband and wife over their bodies. What is the theological significance of this mutual authority?
options: It reflects the reciprocal commitment and unity in marriage
It establishes male dominance over women
It promotes celibacy as superior to marriage
It enforces separation of roles within the household
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects the reciprocal commitment and unity in marriage
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:4 explains that neither the husband nor the wife has exclusive authority over their own body, illustrating mutual submission and unity.

questions.question: What practice does Paul permit by consent for a time between spouses, and what is the purpose of this practice?
options: Temporary abstinence for fasting and prayer
Separation for reflection on marriage
Divorce with reconciliation plans
Non-consummation of marriage
questions.correctAnswer: Temporary abstinence for fasting and prayer
questions.explanation: In 1 Corinthians 7:5, Paul permits couples to abstain temporarily by mutual consent to devote themselves to fasting and prayer.

questions.question: Paul expresses a personal wish regarding marital status in 1 Corinthians 7. What is this wish?
options: That all men were as he is, presumably unmarried
That all men would marry early
That all believers would live in community without marriage
That all men would take multiple wives
questions.correctAnswer: That all men were as he is, presumably unmarried
questions.explanation: Verse 7 states that Paul wishes all men were as he is, which is interpreted as unmarried, but acknowledges different gifts from God.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 7 address the issue of believers married to unbelievers, and what theological concept supports this instruction?
options: Believers should not divorce if the unbelieving spouse consents to live together; the unbelieving spouse is sanctified through the believing partner
Believers must divorce unbelieving spouses immediately
Believers should convert unbelieving spouses before marriage
Believers should avoid marriage with unbelievers altogether
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should not divorce if the unbelieving spouse consents to live together; the unbelieving spouse is sanctified through the believing partner
questions.explanation: Verses 12-14 explain that if the unbelieving spouse consents to live with the believer, they should not be divorced because the unbeliever is sanctified through the believing spouse.

questions.question: Which Old Testament ritual practice does Paul mention in 1 Corinthians 7 to illustrate a point about calling and identity in Christ?
options: Circumcision
Passover
Sacrificial offerings
Levitical purity laws
questions.correctAnswer: Circumcision
questions.explanation: In verses 18-19, Paul refers to circumcision and uncircumcision to emphasize that external rituals are secondary to keeping God's commandments.

questions.question: What does Paul mean when he says, 'Ye are bought with a price; be not ye the servants of men' in 1 Corinthians 7?
options: Believers are redeemed by Christ and should not live as slaves to human masters
Slavery is acceptable if one is called to it
Financial debt is the greatest bondage
Marriage binds one as a servant to the spouse
questions.correctAnswer: Believers are redeemed by Christ and should not live as slaves to human masters
questions.explanation: Verse 23 reflects Paul's theological teaching that Christ’s redemption frees believers from any human bondage.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 7, Paul speaks about virgins and their marital status. How does he counsel virgins in relation to the present distress?
options: It is good for them to remain as they are, unmarried
They must marry immediately to avoid sin
They should separate from the church if unmarried
They should marry unbelievers to bring them to faith
questions.correctAnswer: It is good for them to remain as they are, unmarried
questions.explanation: Verse 26 and 27 suggest that due to present distress, it is good for virgins to remain unmarried, but marrying is not sinful.

questions.question: What literary device is evident in Paul's advice in 1 Corinthians 7:29-31 about the attitude believers should have towards worldly things?
options: Chiasm, emphasizing the transient nature of the world
Allegory, symbolizing spiritual warfare
Parable, illustrating stewardship
Hyperbole, exaggerating urgency
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm, emphasizing the transient nature of the world
questions.explanation: The verses use parallelism and chiasm to highlight the temporary nature of worldly attachments in contrast to eternal priorities.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 7, how does Paul describe the differing concerns of unmarried versus married persons?
options: The unmarried care for the Lord’s interests; the married care for worldly interests and pleasing their spouse
The unmarried care for wealth; the married care for children
The unmarried are careless; the married are responsible
The unmarried are joyful; the married are sorrowful
questions.correctAnswer: The unmarried care for the Lord’s interests; the married care for worldly interests and pleasing their spouse
questions.explanation: Verses 32-34 explain the difference in focus between unmarried and married persons regarding spiritual and worldly responsibilities.

questions.question: What does Paul suggest about a man giving his virgin in marriage if she is past 'the flower of her age' and he behaves uncomely toward her?
options: He may marry her without sinning
He must keep her unmarried regardless
He should send her away immediately
He has sinned and must repent
questions.correctAnswer: He may marry her without sinning
questions.explanation: Verse 36 states that if a man acts uncomely toward his virgin past her prime, he does not sin to marry her.

questions.question: What theological theme is emphasized by Paul’s instruction that the wife is bound by law as long as her husband lives, but after his death she may remarry only 'in the Lord'?
options: The sanctity and permanence of marriage under God
The freedom of remarriage without restriction
The importance of social standing in marriage
The primacy of civil law over divine law
questions.correctAnswer: The sanctity and permanence of marriage under God
questions.explanation: Verse 39 highlights the binding nature of marriage while the husband lives and the condition that remarriage must be within the faith.

questions.question: Which Old Testament concept is closely paralleled by Paul's teaching in 1 Corinthians 7:14 about the sanctification of the unbelieving spouse and children?
options: The concept of 'holy seed' or consecrated lineage in Deuteronomy
The Levitical purity laws
The covenant sign of circumcision
The Sabbath sanctification
questions.correctAnswer: The concept of 'holy seed' or consecrated lineage in Deuteronomy
questions.explanation: Paul’s teaching in verse 14 echoes the OT theme of holiness extending to family lineage, as seen in Deuteronomy's consecration of the seed.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 7, Paul commands all instructions on marriage as direct commands from the Lord.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Paul differentiates between commands from the Lord and his own judgments, as seen in 1 Corinthians 7:6 and 7:12.

questions.question: What aspect of Paul's advice in 1 Corinthians 7 reflects the historical context of the early church facing persecution and social instability?
options: His counsel to remain as one is called and not seek change in marital status
His encouragement to seek wealth and status
His advice to abandon family obligations
His insistence on celibacy for all believers
questions.correctAnswer: His counsel to remain as one is called and not seek change in marital status
questions.explanation: Verses 17, 20, and 27 reflect Paul's practical advice in the context of social unrest, urging believers to remain steadfast in their current state.

theological.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 Corinthians Chapter 7 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 7:3-4, what mutual authority do husband and wife have over each other's bodies?
options: The husband has authority over the wife's body only
Each has authority over their own body exclusively
The wife has authority over the husband's body only
Neither has exclusive authority; each has authority over the other's body
questions.correctAnswer: Neither has exclusive authority; each has authority over the other's body
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:4 states that the wife does not have power over her own body, but the husband does, and likewise the husband does not have power over his own body, but the wife does. This mutual authority is consistent with the biblical teaching of mutual submission (Ephesians 5:21), the one-flesh union (Genesis 2:24), and the call to love one another (John 13:34).

questions.question: What reason does Paul give in 1 Corinthians 7:2 for marriage?
options: To raise children
To avoid fornication
To gain social status
To establish a household
questions.correctAnswer: To avoid fornication
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:2 explains that to avoid fornication, each man should have his own wife and each woman her own husband. This aligns with biblical teaching that marriage guards against sexual immorality (Hebrews 13:4), reflecting God's design for sexual relations (Genesis 2:24), and supports the command to flee sexual immorality (1 Corinthians 6:18).

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 7:10-11, what command regarding separation does Paul give that he attributes directly to the Lord?
options: A wife must not depart from her husband
A wife may freely divorce her husband
The husband can put away his wife at will
A wife should remarry immediately after separation
questions.correctAnswer: A wife must not depart from her husband
questions.explanation: Paul states in 1 Corinthians 7:10 that the Lord commands the wife not to depart from her husband, and if she does, she must remain unmarried or be reconciled. This teaching is consistent with Jesus' teaching on marriage permanence (Matthew 19:6), God's intention for lifelong marriage (Mark 10:9), and the call to faithfulness (Malachi 2:16).

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 7:14 say about the unbelieving spouse in a marriage with a believer?
options: The unbelieving spouse is a hindrance to the believer
The unbelieving spouse is sanctified by the believing spouse
The marriage is invalid
The children are considered unclean
questions.correctAnswer: The unbelieving spouse is sanctified by the believing spouse
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:14 teaches that the unbelieving husband is sanctified by the wife, and the unbelieving wife by the husband, and that the children are holy. This is consistent with Old Testament principles of the sanctifying influence of the godly (Ezra 10:3), the value of the believing spouse (Malachi 2:15), and the inclusion of children in the covenant community (Genesis 17:7).

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 7:23, what is the significance of believers being 'bought with a price'?
options: Believers are obligated to earthly masters
Believers are free from servitude to men
Believers must pay a price to join the church
Believers are slaves to sin
questions.correctAnswer: Believers are free from servitude to men
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:23 declares that believers were bought with a price and should not be servants of men. This refers to Christ’s atoning sacrifice (1 Peter 1:18-19), liberation from sin and bondage (Romans 6:18), and freedom in Christ (Galatians 5:1), emphasizing spiritual freedom and servitude to God alone (Romans 6:22).

questions.question: What guidance does Paul give in 1 Corinthians 7:25-26 about marriage during present distress?
options: He commands all to marry immediately
He forbids marriage entirely
He judges that it is good to remain as one is
He allows only widows to marry
questions.correctAnswer: He judges that it is good to remain as one is
questions.explanation: In 1 Corinthians 7:25-26, Paul states he has no direct command from the Lord but judges it good for people to remain as they are because of present distress. This reflects pastoral sensitivity (James 1:5), prudence in difficult times (Ecclesiastes 3:1), and recognizes the temporary nature of earthly circumstances (Hebrews 11:37-38).

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 7:29-31, how should believers regard their earthly relationships and possessions in light of eschatology?
options: They should invest heavily in worldly things
They should live as though they have no spouses or possessions
They should seek to accumulate wealth for the future
They should reject all earthly relationships
questions.correctAnswer: They should live as though they have no spouses or possessions
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 7:29-31 urges believers to live as though they had no spouses, wept as though they did not, and bought as though they possessed not, because the present form of the world is passing away. This reflects the eschatological perspective found in Philippians 3:20, 1 John 2:17, and Matthew 6:19-21, emphasizing heavenly priorities over earthly attachments.

questions.question: What does Paul indicate about the unmarried person's ability to serve the Lord in 1 Corinthians 7:32-34?
options: Unmarried persons are distracted by worldly concerns
Unmarried persons can focus more fully on pleasing the Lord
Unmarried persons are less holy
Unmarried persons should seek marriage quickly
questions.correctAnswer: Unmarried persons can focus more fully on pleasing the Lord
questions.explanation: Verses 32-34 explain that the unmarried care about the Lord's affairs and how to please Him, whereas married persons are concerned with worldly matters and pleasing their spouse. This highlights the practical advantage of singleness for undistracted service (Luke 2:49), the call to holiness (1 Thessalonians 4:3), and devotion to God (Romans 12:1).

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 7:17-20, what principle does Paul teach about one's social or religious status at the time of calling?
options: One should seek to change status immediately
One should abandon previous customs
One should remain in the status in which they were called
One must be circumcised to be saved
questions.correctAnswer: One should remain in the status in which they were called
questions.explanation: Paul instructs believers to abide in the calling they had when called (7:17,20), whether circumcised or not, slave or free. This teaches contentment and faithfulness in one's present situation (Philippians 4:11), the primacy of obedience over ritual (Romans 2:28-29), and God's sovereignty in calling (Romans 8:28).

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 7:16 address the potential for salvation of an unbelieving spouse?
options: Believers should divorce unbelieving spouses immediately
There is no hope to save an unbelieving spouse
The believing spouse may save the unbelieving spouse
Salvation depends solely on family tradition
questions.correctAnswer: The believing spouse may save the unbelieving spouse
questions.explanation: Verse 16 asks rhetorically how a wife knows she will save her unbelieving husband or how a husband knows he will save his unbelieving wife, implying the possibility. This aligns with biblical examples of salvation through a believing spouse (1 Peter 3:1-2), the power of intercession (James 5:16), and God's desire for all to be saved (1 Timothy 2:4).

questions.question: What does Paul say in 1 Corinthians 7:7 about the diversity of gifts from God concerning marriage and singleness?
options: All should be married like Paul
Singleness is a gift from God for some
Marriage is required for salvation
Singleness is a sign of spiritual failure
questions.correctAnswer: Singleness is a gift from God for some
questions.explanation: Paul states in 7:7 that he wishes all were as he (single), but each has a gift from God, one this way, another that. This recognizes singleness as a valid gift (Matthew 19:12), supporting diverse callings (Romans 12:6), and honoring God's sovereign distribution of gifts (1 Corinthians 12:4-6).

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 7:39, under what condition may a widow remarry?
options: Only if she marries within her tribe
Only in the Lord
Only if she has no children
Widows may not remarry
questions.correctAnswer: Only in the Lord
questions.explanation: Verse 39 permits a widow to remarry, but only in the Lord, indicating she should marry a fellow believer. This aligns with biblical principles of marrying 'only in the Lord' (2 Corinthians 6:14), maintaining spiritual unity (Amos 3:3), and sanctity of the marriage covenant (Hebrews 13:4).

questions.question: What exhortation does Paul give in 1 Corinthians 7:24 regarding one’s calling?
options: Change your calling whenever possible
Abandon your calling for a better one
Abide in your calling with God
Seek higher social status
questions.correctAnswer: Abide in your calling with God
questions.explanation: Paul urges believers to remain in the calling wherein they were called with God (7:24), highlighting faithfulness and contentment (Philippians 1:27), trusting God’s providence (Proverbs 3:5-6), and honoring God in all circumstances (Colossians 3:23).

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 7:5, what is the recommended practice for spouses regarding temporary abstinence?
options: Permanent abstinence until children are born
Temporary abstinence with mutual consent for prayer and fasting
Abstinence only during pregnancy
No abstinence allowed
questions.correctAnswer: Temporary abstinence with mutual consent for prayer and fasting
questions.explanation: Verse 5 advises spouses not to deprive one another except by mutual consent for a time to devote themselves to fasting and prayer, then to come together again to avoid temptation. This shows respect for marital duties (Hebrews 13:4), spiritual disciplines (Matthew 6:16-18), and the reality of spiritual warfare (Ephesians 6:12).

questions.question: What does Paul teach in 1 Corinthians 7:18-19 about circumcision and obedience to God's commandments?
options: Circumcision is essential for salvation
Obedience to God's commandments is what matters, not circumcision
Uncircumcised believers are less holy
Only circumcised people may enter the church
questions.correctAnswer: Obedience to God's commandments is what matters, not circumcision
questions.explanation: Verses 18-19 state that circumcision or uncircumcision counts for nothing but keeping God's commandments. This affirms the New Testament teaching of salvation by faith and obedience rather than ritual (Galatians 5:6), the circumcision of the heart (Romans 2:29), and prioritizing righteousness (Deuteronomy 10:12).
